FuncDef: The reset mpls traffic-statistics mldp p2mp command deletes mLDP P2MP LSP statistics.
CLIs: reset mpls traffic-statistics mldp p2mp [ root-ip <root-ip> { lsp-id <lsp-id> | opaque-value <opaque-value> } | in-label <in-label-value> ]

ParaDef.Info:
Deletes statistics about traffic transmitted on an mLDP P2MP LSP with a specified root IP address.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Deletes statistics about traffic transmitted on an mLDP P2MP LSP with a specified P2MP ID.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 4294967295.

Deletes statistics about traffic transmitted on an mLDP P2MP LSP with a specified opaque value.
The value is a hexadecimal string of 1 to 254 characters.

Deletes statistics about traffic transmitted on an mLDP P2MP LSP with a specified incoming label value.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 4294967295.

Examples: <HUAWEI> reset mpls traffic-statistics mldp p2mp root-ip 10.1.1.9 lsp-id 1
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
Before collecting statistics, run the reset mpls traffic-statistics mldp p2mp command to delete existing FEC traffic statistics.
Configuration Impact
After the reset mpls traffic-statistics mldp p2mp command is run, existing traffic statistics are deleted, which cannot be restored.
